metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3709 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Function check_attachment_for_errors() in file data/general-hooks/ubuntu.py could be tricked into exposing private data via a constructed crash file. This issue affects: apport 2.14.1 versions prior to 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm8; 2.20.1 versions prior to 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm2; 2.20.9 versions prior to 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.26; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.20; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu65.3;

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3709` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu69
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu69').
